items.description: Development of the in-house database whose public frontend can be seen at database.passivehouse.com
Administration of the host machine running kodeaffe.de and a couple of other domains.
Example implementation of a web service to monitor and control an ESP8266
A little tool to download issues of the Jungle World and convert them to epub

Administration of the company's hard- and software, provisioning of Linux servers in the cloud. Developing utility software for the company's pet project: OpenBankProject, e.g. API Manager and various Python scripts
Implemented kodeaffe.de using a homebrew system based on iron. Also improved responsiveness in frontend.
Development of a little Android app to facilitate learning a few plant families
Switch from previous freelance work to full-time employment. Worked on these sites: quartiermeister, start green, Zukunftsmacher-Plattform, Why are houses collapsing in Egypt?, ,
Implemented the backend and some of the frontend for ecobasa.org, a website to connect people and communities
Freelance Development of a social media / groupware platform
System administrator for the company"s hard- and software: phone system, internal and external Linux servers. Also writing applications for external clients
Implemented kodeaffe.de using a homebrew system based on express.js

Improved the performance and internal architecture of a large legacy web application with dependencies to other in-house applications. Notably, moving from Jython to cPython and reworking the URL configuration system.
A little tool to download issues of the Jungle World and compress into single HTML file, so it can be easily converted to epub

Development of a website to watch representative (in)action in collaboration with Transparency International Georgia (TIG) and Caucasus Institute for Peace Democracy and Development (CIPDD). Representatives of National Parliament, Tbilisi City Hall + Ajara Supreme Council are watched, pulling in data from various TIG + CIPDD projects: voting behaviour + presence, income declarations, parliament alerts, questions, etc.
Building and hosting the website of the upcoming Tbilisi hackerspace called Tbilisi Open Labs - TOL

items.header: Lead Developer at Transparency International Georgia
items.description: Redevelopment of TI Georgia"s website, maintainance and enhancement of the backend to Parliament Alert service, graphical visualisation of the georgian advertising sector, maintenance and enhancement of a scraper for government income declarations
A little application to learn georgian letters by flash cards (mediocre user interface).
Patch to introduce 8-byte padding into owncloud's crypto library. This is a precursor to implement server-side encryption.
Development of a website for a local energy reseller.
Patch to make the Age Verification Module work again on Ubercart (2.4) on Drupal 6 (6.22)
Ad-hoc one weekend team coding (see Random Hacks of Kindness) of a weather mashup to aggregate different weather sources into one website to compare forecasts and warnings. RHoK Solution.
Improvement of the current website and development of new features for a website advocating Vegetarianism and Veganism (for a russian-speaking audience).
Development of a CMS for a music publisher's website in collaboration with silverspoon.de
Development of a CMS for a music producer's website in collaboration with silverspoon.de
A demo to showcase HTML5
Development of mldata.org, a machine learning data set repository, a collaboration between TU Berlin, University of Southampton and others.
Development of a CMS for an artist's website in collaboration with silverspoon.de.
Administration of the Linux workstations in the Galway Social Space, Galway, Ireland.
With this patch, GNOME Screensaver will show the current time when the login box is presented to the user.
Development of a CMS for an artist's website in collaboration with silverspoon.de.
This tool calculates the liquid ozone consumption of your ship when using a jump bridge. It features short-cut distances for DEFY jump bridges. Do not worry if this does not make any sense to you. :)
Participiation in the development of groundcrew: it can involve you in a million different kinds of things in your community, from pick-up sports games, to volunteering, to giant art projects.

This tool checks your character"s remaining skill training time, using EVE"s API. It also shows you the name of the skill and to which level it is trained. Available as command-line application and GNOME applet.
This set of files implements a plugin for logwatch to make use of the logfiles generated by denyhosts.
Participiation in the development of SHOGUN, a new machine learning toolbox with focus on large scale kernel methods and especially on Support Vector Machines (SVM) with focus to bioinformatics.

Two scripts to automate access to Tvorteil and VHD portal. They might not work out of the box for you, because they just got ripped out of another system. And of course, you need regular logins to Telekom"s servers...
Development of a Debian package for calcurse, a text-based personal organiser.

• Implementation of a Python application to automatically move sites between exchanges in Nokia"s ActioNet.
  • Security fix-up of various servers: user roles, SSH public key authentication.
  • Implementation of an SNMP monitoring system on various servers.
  • Refactoring and proof-reading of router software for Nokia"s ActioNet and Fleetlink.
  • Various bugfixes and small features implemented in client"s CRM system (SugarCRM).
A module for Drupal 5.1 to hide (in the sense of Indymedia) nodes and comments.
A set of scripts to export user profile data from Couchsurfing into a microformat and to import that data into an internal format for Ridesurf.
Python module to retrieve the MAC address from a host"s given IP address.
Development of a web- and SMS-based messaging platform.
A database conversion script from DadaIMC 0.98 to Drupal 4.72.
Administration of the Linux workstations and servers in the Oblong Internet Cafe, Te Aro, Wellington, NZ.
Debian package which contains a Perl module for manipulating iptables rules. This package is needed for linblock. You can also get the complete sources.
Debian package to automatically download antip2p blacklist + install into Linux"s IPTables. You can also get the complete sources.
Report about GNU/Linux on an MSI S270W.
Development of a Linux-based VPN system for the remote control of a smartphone named HandyPC.
Package for easier un-/install of qpspmanager under Debian GNU/Linux.
Small patch to determine amateurishly the version of the attached Playstation Portable in order to disable some features of QPSPManager.
Installation, configuration and modification of Linux on mobile systems.
Linux and Wireless Geek for Geekcorps in Mali.
Debian maintenance of a package to convert databases from the Wik-family (Wikipedia, Wiktionary, etc.) to dict.
Development of a tourism website.

When the Apple II emulation of the BSOD starts to emulate the display of a distorted analogue TV, CPU usage rises to 100% on my PowerBook. This little patch introduces a 1 microsecond sleep (it did not seem to make a difference if set to 500 or anything below). Note that this is not a fix, merely a hack.

USBView is a small application to make all devices attached to the USB visible. Unfortunately, upstream recently told me that there exists some GTK2 port in his repository and some discussions revealed that the interface to USB devices provided by sysfs will probably never show the information as complete as proc. Nevertheless, this version features:
  • GTK2 port
  • sysfs support
  • I18N support for: de, cs
  • .desktop file and icon

When a node is added to sysfs (e.g. a device plugged in via USB), the filesystem fails to make this change visible in the parent directory"s ctime/mtime. This is in contrast to removing a device, because in that case, sysfs makes use of the function simple_unlink from fs/libfs.c which takes care of that. Instead of using simple_link from fs/libfs.c on creation, sysfs implements its own mechanism. This patch hooks into the function sysfs_create and sets the ctime and the mtime of the parent to CURRENT_TIME.

wmbatppc is similar to wmacpi but for powerpc. It proves to be handling xosd issues not well if something fails. The whole program barfed on me, because libxosd tried to load some fonts it could not find due to problems with my locale (Xlib does not support de_DE.UTF8). This patch warns about xosd errors and disables xosd features at run-time. The homepage of wmbatppc can be found here (homepage).
Debian maintenance of irda-utils, a package with `tools to access and connect IrDA devices.
Latest addition: fluxbox 0.9.13 compiled for powerpc. Some stuff like kernel .config, System.map and .deb for a PowerBook G4 (Aluminium).

yafc makes false assumptions about the behaviour of real life FTP servers. In this case, it believes to get _all_ files from the server when issueing "LIST", but this is not true for at least proFTPd 1.2.[59] which does not serve the hidden dot files. This patch makes "ls -a" work again. Also check the Debian bug page.

A small patch which reintroduces a fixed version of 10_lfs.dpatch which seems to be necessary if you want to up-/download already existing files to/from a FTP server if you are on _PowerPC_. Otherwise, yafc will segfault. Check the homepage of yafc and the Debian bug page.
This patch introduces ranges when (un)deleting mails, like "del 1-3 5 9-12". pop3browser does not seem to have a homepage, so perhaps you might have a look at the Debian page.
Testing and translation into German. CDW is a frontend to cdrecord/mkisofs for the console, based on ncurses.
Debian maintenance of a Windowmaker Dockapplet to visualize ACPI information.
Development and Maintenance of the website of the ACPI4Linux project.

Small patch to check the presence of batteries in /proc/acpi/battery more properly and thus making wmacpi useful for my Toshiba. The patch has been sent to upstream, but no answer yet. Apply with patch -p0 < wmacpi-1.34.diff in the directory above wmacpi-1.34/. See the homepage for more info. UPDATE: Meanwhile, someone more determined has decided to take over the package (with my support as Debian maintainer), check wmacpi-ng, alias wmacpi-2.0 at himi.org.
Debian maintenance of a GTK 2.x theme engine, containing 4 different styles.
Debian maintenance of a GTK 2.x theme engine, containing 3 different styles.
Installation, configuration and modification of Linux on mobile systems.
Debian maintenance of a GNOME applet for xpenguins, see the homepage of xpenguins for more info.

Port of the applet to GNOME2.
You can download the release 2.1.1 as a tarball or as Debian package.
Model viewer for the Aurora models from NeverwinterNights.
Patch for bubblemon 1.4 to display the uptime of the system.
A report about Debian GNU/Linux on the Toshiba Satellite 3000-601.
A simple OggVorbis tag-editor for KDE.
A platform-independant encoder for OggVorbis, a free audio codec.
Systems Administration and Lead web developer at defcom.de, e.g. mtv.de, ottifanten.de or fettesbrot.de.
Web developer at MCY.com
Zivildienstleistender in the computer centre of the Max-Bürger-Zentrum.
Trainee in the computer centre of the HU Berlin.
